description: Update documentation to reflect the new interactive mode and its features.
instructions: Locate the section describing the CLI options.
Add a clear description of the new `--interactive` or `-i` CLI option, explaining its purpose (entering an interactive session).
Create a new top-level section or a sub-section specifically for 'Interactive Mode'.
Within the 'Interactive Mode' section, provide detailed instructions on how to start an interactive session using the CLI option.
Explain the basic interaction flow within the interactive mode, specifically mentioning how to use the 'list-models' command.
Add a sub-section or clear instruction block explaining how users can gracefully exit the interactive session (e.g., using 'exit', 'quit', or Ctrl+C if applicable).
Ensure the language is clear, concise, and user-friendly.
Review the updated documentation for accuracy and completeness regarding the interactive mode features implemented.
constraints: Documentation should be clear and user-friendly.
All new features implemented in this plan should be documented.
Updates should be integrated logically into the existing documentation structure.
validation_criteria: README.md includes information about the interactive mode CLI option.
docs/index.md contains a dedicated section for 'Interactive Mode'.
The 'Interactive Mode' section in docs/index.md clearly explains how to start an interactive session.
The 'Interactive Mode' section in docs/index.md explains how to use the 'list-models' command within the interactive session.
The documentation clearly explains how to exit the interactive session gracefully.
name: update_documentation
